creator: Nick.Holloway@pyrites.org.uk
text:
Apache (1.3.12) is configured to use Tomcat 3.2.1 and SSI using the following 
directives in httpd.conf:

    ApJServMount /servlet /ROOT
    AddType test/jsp .jsp
    AddHandler jserv-servlet .jsp
    AddType text/html .shtml
    AddHandler server-parsed .shtml

In the root context create the file "test.shtml" containing:

    Top
    <!--#include virtual="/test/jsp"-->
    Bottom

Create "test.jsp" with anything you like.

When you request "/test.shtml" you see that you get the output "Top Top Bottom 
Bottom".

This appears to be because the connector is passing the URL of the page to 
Tomcat, instead of the URL from the SSI tag.

The reason for wanting to use SSI rather than <jsp:include> is that I intend to 
include the output of the JSP from a "non-JSP context" (a 3rd party will be 
developing plain html pages, and not using JSP, but do want to include some 
dynamically generated content).

creator: Nick.Holloway@pyrites.org.uk
text:
Some further information.

This is only a problem with mod_jserv, as using mod_jk functions correctly.

creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
text: Use mod_jk, mod_jserv is not actively developed.
